sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS TO BE HELD MAY 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO THE SHAREHOLDERS OF SCRIPPS NETWORKS INTERACTIVE, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of the Shareholders of Scripps Networks Interactive, Inc. (the Company) will be held at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN 37804, on Tuesday, May 9, 2017, at 2:30 p.m., local time, to consider:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of the 12 director nominees identified in the proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Advisory approval of the compensation of the Companys named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Advisory approval of the frequency of the shareholder vote on the compensation of the Companys named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Ratification of the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP to serve as our independent auditor for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Such other business as may properly come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has set the close of business on March 13, 2017 as the record date for the determination of shareholders who are entitled to notice of and to vote at the meeting and any adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are furnishing our proxy materials to you under U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission rules that allow companies to deliver proxy materials to their shareholders on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 29, 2017, we began mailing a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) and provided access to our proxy materials on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy materials include the 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders and the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, it is important that your shares be represented whether or not you are personally able to attend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please vote as instructed in the Notice, via the Internet or the telephone as promptly as possible to ensure that your vote is recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you may follow the procedures outlined in the Notice to request a paper proxy card to submit your vote by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the meeting and your shares are registered in your name, you may withdraw your proxy at that time and vote your shares in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy is being solicited by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eleni Vatsis Stratigeas Senior Vice President, Business and Legal Affairs and Corporate Secretary

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT 2016 ANNUAL MEETING May 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is being furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of Directors (the Board) of Scripps Networks Interactive, Inc., an Ohio corporation (the Company), for use at the Companys Annual Meeting of Shareholders (the Annual Meeting), which will be held on Tuesday, May 9, 2017, at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN 37804, at 2:30 p.m., local time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The close of business on March 13, 2017, has been set as the record date for the determination of shareholders entitled to notice of and to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADMISSION PROCEDURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we are committed to providing a safe, secure environment for our shareholders, employees, and guests, we kindly ask that you observe the following procedures if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before the meeting: Please register on or before May 7, 2017, by contacting Eleni Stratigeas, our Senior Vice President, Business and Legal Affairs and Corporate Secretary, at (865) 560-3326 or estratigeas@scrippsnetworks.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the meeting and need special assistance because of a disability, please contact the corporate secretarys office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When you arrive: Company representatives will be available to direct you to the meeting room where you can check in at the registration table beginning at 2:00 p.m. local time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What to bring: If your shares are registered in the name of a bank, broker, or other holder of record, please bring both a photo ID and documentation of your stock ownership as of March 13, 2017 (such as a brokerage statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered in your name, either solely or jointly with one or more co-owners, you will just need a photo ID.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INTERNET AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are furnishing proxy materials to our shareholders primarily via the Internet under rules adopted by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, instead of mailing printed copies of those materials to each shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 29, 2017, we mailed to our shareholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials containing instructions on how to access our proxy materials, including our Proxy Statement and our Annual Report to Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials also instructs you on how to access your proxy card or to vote via the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is designed to expedite the shareholders receipt of proxy materials, lower the cost of the Annual Meeting and help conserve natural resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who would prefer to continue to receive printed proxy materials should follow the instructions included in the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTING PROCEDURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 13, 2017, the Company had outstanding 95,858,201 Class A Common Shares, $.01 par value per share (Class A Common Shares), and 33,850,481 Common Voting Shares, $.01 par value per share (Common Voting Shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of Class A Common Shares are entitled to elect the greater of three or one-third (or the nearest smaller whole number if such fraction is not a whole number) of the directors of the Company but are not entitled to vote on any other matters except as required by Ohio law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of Common Voting Shares are entitled to elect all remaining directors and to vote on all other matters requiring a vote of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Class A Common Share and Common Voting Share is entitled to one vote upon matters on which such class of shares is entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of Class A Common Shares and Common Voting Shares do not have cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum of shareholders is necessary to hold a valid meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of the outstanding Class A Common Shares is necessary for the election of the four directors to be elected by the holders of the Class A Common Shares and the presence, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of the outstanding Common Voting Shares is necessary for any other action to be taken at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the election of directors, when a quorum of holders of Class A Common Shares and Common Voting Shares, respectively, is present at an annual meeting in which directors are elected, directors shall be elected by a plurality of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this standard, the eight (8) director nominees to be elected by the holders of Common Voting Shares (voting separately as a class) and four (4) director nominees to be elected by the holders of Class A Common Shares (voting separately as a class), in each case who receive the greatest number of votes will become directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to any other matter to be voted upon, when a quorum of holders of Common Voting Shares is present at an annual meeting, the vote of the holders of a majority of the Common Voting Shares, issued and outstanding and entitled to vote there at, present in person or by proxy, shall decide any question brought before such meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the election of directors, a shareholder may vote for a director nominee or may withhold such shareholders vote for a director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Withheld votes will be treated as present at the meeting for purposes of establishing a quorum for the meeting and for purposes of the vote on a particular matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A withheld vote will have no effect on the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to any other matter to be voted upon, a shareholder may vote for or against such matter or may abstain from voting for such matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will be treated as present at the meeting for purposes of establishing a quorum for the meeting and for purposes of the vote on the particular matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the same effect as a vote against the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes also will be treated as present at the meeting for purposes of establishing a quorum for the meeting, but will not be treated as shares present for purposes of the vote on the particular matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote will have no effect on the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a broker or other nominee does not vote shares on a non-routine matter, such as the election of directors, because the broker or nominee does not have discretionary voting power for the particular matter and has not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner of the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence of any shareholder at the meeting will not operate to revoke his or her proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy may be revoked at any time, if it has not been exercised, by giving written notice to the Company or in open meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder signs and submits such shareholders proxy without voting instructions with respect to the proposals contained herein, the proxy will be voted for such proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record (i.e., if your shares are registered directly in your name in the records of our transfer agent, Wells Fargo), you can vote using one of the methods described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner (i.e., you indirectly hold your shares through a nominee such as a bank or broker), you can vote using the methods provided by your nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTE BY INTERNET www.proxyvote.com Have your 16-Digit Control Number (printed in the box marked by the arrow on the notice or proxy card) and follow the instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTE BY PHONE 1-800-690-6903 Use any touch-tone telephone to transmit your voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO REQUEST A PAPER OR E-MAIL COPY If you want to receive a paper or email copy of these documents, you must request one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is NO charge for requesting a copy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please choose one of the following methods to make your request:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) BY INTERNET: www.proxyvote.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3) BY EMAIL*: sendmaterial@proxyvote.com *  If requesting materials by email, please send a blank email with your 16-Digit Control Number in the subject line (your Control Number can be found in the box marked by the arrow on the notice or proxy card).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests, instructions and other inquiries sent to this email address will NOT be forwarded to your investment advisor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please make the request as instructed above on or before April 25, 2017 to facilitate timely delivery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Select Performance and Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 showed strong increases from the prior year in key financial metrics:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: o Operating Revenue $3.4 billion  up 12.7%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: o Segment Profit1 $1.4 billion  up 12.5%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: o Diluted Earnings per Share $5.18  up 11.2%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HGTV had its highest-rated and most watched year ever, finishing 2016 ranked #3 among all cable networks for total adult viewers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Food Network ranked #13 among ad-supported cable networks for adults aged 25-54.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TVN continued to grow market share in 2016, achieving a 23% share while ratings at TVN Group improved 4% with its target audience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Travel Channels ratings improved 11% in 2016 for adult viewers aged 25-54
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scripps Lifestyle Studios delivered more than 5 billion video views across all digital platforms in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued growth in international businesses with networks expanding distribution in numerous markets, including Argentina Brazil, Canada, Mexico, the Middle East and North Africa and New Zealand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1 See reconciliation of Segment Profit to GAAP measure in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company seeks to align the interests of our named executive officers (NEOs) with the interests of the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain important features of our executive compensation program include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is designed to align financial results and sustainable shareholder value creation with the compensation of our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay is tied to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 84% of our Chief Executive Officers and approximately 68% of the other NEOs fiscal 2016 target total direct compensation was based on variable (or at risk) pay elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: o 100% of each NEOs annual incentive award and 30% of each NEOs long-term incentive award is subject to achievement of short-term and long-term financial and business objectives, with the remainder of the long-term incentive award comprised of stock options and restricted stock units (RSUs), designed to reward the NEOs for increasing the Companys stock price and enhancing long-term value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: o Strong 2016 performance resulted in above-target payouts under the NEOs 2016 annual incentive awards and for the performance-based restricted share units (PBRSUs) award portion of their 2015 long-term incentive awards (with a performance period ended December 31, 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains stock ownership guidelines that apply to all executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has strong governance policies related to executive compensation, and we employ appropriate compensation risk mitigating features.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A board of 12 directors is to be elected, four by the holders of Class A Common Shares voting separately as a class and eight by the holders of Common Voting Shares voting separately as a class.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the election, the nominees receiving the greatest number of votes will be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Withheld votes and broker non-votes will have no effect on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each proxy for Class A Common Shares executed and returned by a holder of such shares will be voted for the election of the four directors hereinafter shown as nominees for such class of shares, unless otherwise indicated on such proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each proxy for Common Voting Shares executed and returned by a holder of such shares will be voted for the election of the eight directors hereinafter shown as nominees for such class of shares, unless otherwise indicated on such proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board does not contemplate that any of the nominees hereinafter named will be unavailable for election, in the event that any such nominee is unable to serve, the proxies will be voted for the remaining nominees and for such other person(s), if any, as the Board may propose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Paumgarten will turn 72 years old before the 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As set forth in the Companys Corporate Governance Principles, it is the general policy of the Company that the retirement age for directors is 72 years of age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board, upon the recommendation of the Nominating and Governance Committee, has decided to make an exception to this retirement policy for Mr. Paumgarten until the 2017 annual meeting of shareholders due to Mr. Paumgartens extensive knowledge, experience and his deep understanding of the media industry, and has concluded that the Company would benefit from his continued service as a member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote FOR the election of the nominated directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPORT ON THE NOMINEES FOR ELECTION TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Scripps Family Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Edward W. Scripps Trust (the Trust), the former controlling shareholder of the Company, ended on October 18, 2012 upon the death of Robert P. Scripps, a grandson of the founder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was the last of Edward W. Scripps grandchildren upon whom the duration of the Trust was based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March and September of 2013, the Trust distributed the Class A Common Shares and Common Voting Shares held by the Trust to the beneficiaries of the Trust and to trust and guardian arrangements on behalf of the Minors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain beneficiaries of the Trust and their descendants and certain members of the John P. Scripps family and trusts for their benefit are signatories to the Scripps Family Agreement, which governs the transfer and voting of Common Voting Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Minors Shares are not subject to the Scripps Family Agreement, and the Minors may or may not become parties in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Provisions of the Scripps Family Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 9 of the Scripps Family Agreement provides that the Company will call a meeting of the signatories to the Scripps Family Agreement (the Signatories) prior to each annual or special meeting of the shareholders of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each of these meetings, the Company will discuss with the Signatories each matter, including election of directors, that the Company will submit to the holders of Common Voting Shares at the annual meeting or special meeting with respect to which the meeting under the Scripps Family Agreement has been called.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Signatory is entitled, either in person or by proxy, to cast one vote for each Common Voting Share owned of record or beneficially by the Signatory on each matter brought for a vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Signatory is bound by the decision reached by majority vote with respect to each such matter, and at the related annual or special meeting of the shareholders of the Company each Signatory is required to vote the Signatorys Common Voting Shares in accordance with the decisions reached at the meeting of the Signatories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Signatories have informed the Company that at a March 10, 2017 meeting of the Signatories held pursuant to the Scripps Family Agreement, the Signatories approved election of the eight director nominees to be voted on by the holders of Common Voting Shares and approved Proposals 2, 3 and 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, based on such approval, the Signatories have informed the Company that they
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will vote the Common Voting Shares held of record by them in favor of such nominees and for Proposals 2, 3 and 4 at the annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transfer Restrictions of the Scripps Family Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signatories cannot dispose of any Common Voting Shares (except as otherwise summarized below) without first giving other Signatories and the Company the opportunity to purchase the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signatories cannot convert Common Voting Shares into Class A Common Shares except for a limited period of time after giving other Signatories and the Company the opportunity to purchase such shares and in certain other limited circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signatories are permitted to transfer Common Voting Shares to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) their lineal descendants, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) certain charitable organizations, trusts and entities that are controlled by, or for which the power to vote and dispose of the Common Voting Shares is directed by, descendants of Robert P. Scripps or John P. Scripps.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Descendants to whom the shares are sold or transferred outright, and trustees and other persons with voting and dispositive power with respect to charitable organizations, trusts and entities into which such shares are transferred, must become parties to the Scripps Family Agreement or the shares will be deemed to be offered for sale pursuant to the Scripps Family Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signatories also are permitted to transfer Common Voting Shares by testamentary transfer to their spouses provided the shares are converted to Class A Common Shares and to pledge the shares as collateral security provided that the pledgee agrees to be bound by the terms of the Scripps Family Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If title to any such shares subject to any trust is transferred to anyone other than a descendant of Robert P. Scripps or John P. Scripps, or if a person who is a descendant of Robert P. Scripps or John P. Scripps acquires outright any such shares held in trust but is not or does not become a party to the Scripps Family Agreement, such shares will be deemed to be offered for sale pursuant to the Scripps Family Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any valid transfer of Common Voting Shares made by Signatories without compliance with the Scripps Family Agreement will result in automatic conversion of such shares to Class A Common Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Duration of the Scripps Family Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provisions restricting transfer of Common Voting Shares under the Scripps Family Agreement will continue until 21 years after the death of the last survivor of the descendants of Robert P. Scripps and John P. Scripps alive when the Trust terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provisions of the Scripps Family Agreement governing the voting of Common Voting Shares will be effective for a 10-year period after termination of the Trust and may be renewed for additional 10-year periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kenneth W. Lowe, Chair, Nicholas B. Paumgarten and Mary McCabe Peirce are the members of the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may delegate authority to the Executive Committee to exercise certain powers of the Board in the management of the business and affairs of the Company between Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee did not meet in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ronald W. Tysoe, Chair, Michael R. Costa, Donald E. Meihaus, Richelle P. Parham and Jeffrey Sagansky are the members of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibility relating to: (1) the integrity of the Companys financial statements and financial reporting process and the Companys systems of internal accounting and financial controls; (2) the performance of the internal audit services function; (3) the annual independent audit of the Companys financial statements, the engagement of the independent auditors and the evaluation of the independent auditors qualifications, independence, performance and fees; (4) the compliance by the Company with legal and regulatory requirements, including the Companys disclosure controls and procedures; (5) the evaluation of enterprise risk issues; and (6) the fulfillment of all other responsibilities as outlined in its charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The internal and independent auditors have unrestricted access to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets privately with each of the independent auditors, the internal auditors and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Audit Committee held seven meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Audit Committee is financially literate, under applicable Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and NASDAQ Global Select Market (NASDAQ) standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Messrs. Tysoe and Costa each is an audit committee financial expert, as defined under SEC regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Audit Committee may receive any compensation, consulting, advisory or other fee from the Company, other than the Board compensation described elsewhere in this proxy statement, as determined in accordance with applicable SEC and NASDAQ rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not limit the number of other audit committees on which the members serve; however, in each case, the Board evaluates and determines whether commitments to serve on other audit committees impairs such members effective service to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Tysoe and Sagansky currently serve on the audit committees of two public companies, in addition to service on the Audit Committee of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board reviewed these service commitments and determined that such simultaneous service does not impair their ability to effectively serve on the Companys Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jarl Mohn, Chair, Gina L. Bianchini, Michael R. Costa, Ronald W. Tysoe, and David A. Galloway are the members of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent, if elected, will be a member of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is appointed by the Board to discharge the Boards responsibilities relating to compensation of the Companys officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves the Companys goals and objectives relevant to compensation of senior management and evaluates the performance of senior management in light of those goals and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the senior managers, the Compensation Committee establishes base compensation levels, the terms of incentive compensation plans and equity-based plans and post-service arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves all awards under the Companys Long-Term Incentive Plan and approves awards under the Companys Executive Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews all of the components of the chief executive officers compensation, including goals and objectives, and makes recommendations to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to any funded employee benefit plans, the Compensation Committee appoints and monitors named fiduciaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the Compensation Committee reviews the operation of the Companys compensation program to evaluate its coordination and execution and reviews any management perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews succession planning relating to positions held by senior officers and makes recommendations with respect thereto to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the authority to engage outside consultants to assist in determining appropriate compensation levels for the chief executive officer, other senior managers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is also responsible for producing an annual report for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement and for reviewing and approving the Compensation Discussion & Analysis and related compensation disclosure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Compensation Committee held four meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Governance Committee.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose is to: (1) to assist the Board by identifying individuals qualified to become board members and to recommend director nominees to the Board and to the signatories to the Scripps Family Agreement; (2) to recommend to the Board the Corporate Governance Principles applicable to the Company; (3) to lead the Board in its annual review of the Boards performance; (4) to recommend to the Board nominees for each committee of the Board; and (5) to review and make recommendations with respect to director compensation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Nominating and Governance Committee held four meetings.

sentences.text: Code of Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company demonstrates its commitment to operate at the highest ethical standards by enforcing the principles in its Code of Ethics which is applicable to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer is responsible for implementation and oversight of the ethics program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Company has in place a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for the Chief Executive Officer and the Senior Financial Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the responsibility of the Audit Committee and the Chief Financial Officer to make sure that this policy is operative and has effective reporting and enforcement mechanisms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for the Chief Executive Officer and Senior Financial Officers is available for review on the Companys website and to any shareholder who requests a printed copy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendments to the policies and waivers of provisions applicable to executive officers or directors may only be made by the Board or an authorized committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such amendment or waiver will be promptly disclosed on the Companys website within four business days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes it has an obligation to provide employees with the guidance and support needed to ensure that the best, most ethical choices are made at work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To support this commitment, the Company established a means for employees to submit confidential and anonymous reports of suspected or actual violations of the Companys Code of Ethics relating, among other things, to: accounting and auditing matters; antitrust activity; confidentiality and misappropriation; conflicts of interest, discrimination or harassment; diverting of product or business activity; embezzlement; falsification of contracts, reports or records; gifts or entertainment; improper supplier or contractor activity; securities violations; sexual harassment; substance abuse; theft; or unsafe working conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To submit a report, an employee may call a toll-free number that is answered by a trained professional of EthicsPoint, an independent firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This number (888- 258-3507) is operational 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may also raise questions online through the Internet (www.ethicspoint.com).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Charitable Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not made any charitable contributions, where the amount has exceeded $1 million or 2 percent of such charitys consolidated gross revenues, to any charitable organization of which a director is an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kenneth W. Lowe serves as both the Chairman of the Companys Board and as its President and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also appointed an independent lead director, Nicholas B. Paumgarten, who presides at all meetings of the Board at which the chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director also serves as a liaison between the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer and the independent directors, which includes sharing with the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer such observations, comments or concerns as he and the other independent directors deem appropriate, reviews with the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer matters to be presented to the Board and has the authority to call meetings of the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys enterprise risk issues are reviewed by the Audit Committee, which reports on such issues to the Board based on periodic reports from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officers performance is reviewed annually by the Compensation Committee, which reports such determinations to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company deems this leadership structure appropriate as it promotes efficiency in communications between the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer and the Board while monitoring effective independent board oversight over the President and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also believes that its leadership structure supports the risk oversight function of the Board described in more detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk oversight is primarily the responsibility of Company management, while the Board has ultimate responsibility for overseeing managements risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board uses various means to fulfill this responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain risks that fall under the purview of a particular committee are monitored by that committee, which then reports to the full Board as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the committees of the Board addresses risks that fall within the committees areas of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Audit Committee reviews managements enterprise risk management report, managements audit plan and reports, legal and regulatory reports, treasury and insurance operations, the Companys information technology risks and mitigation strategies, the tax function, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Company's business code of conduct and compliance program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These management reports address significant risks such as operational, strategic, legal, regulatory, financial, technological, and reputational risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee addresses risks arising out of the Companys executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain risks which may relate to various market and economic assumptions that might be key risk indicators to the Companys growth and strategic plans are addressed in connection with the Boards annual review of the Companys strategic plan and planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also has the opportunity to address such risks at each Board meeting in connection with its regular review of significant business and financial developments as presented by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also reviews risks arising out of specific significant transactions when these transactions are presented to the Board for review or approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications with the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders and other interested parties wishing to communicate with the independent directors as a group or with any individual director (including the lead director) may do so by addressing a letter to the independent directors or to the individual director and sending it to them in care of the corporate secretary at 9721 Sherrill Blvd., Knoxville, TN 37932.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For those who wish to send such communications via e-mail, they can do so to estratigeas@scrippsnetworks.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the independent directors have instructed the corporate secretary to review all communications so received, and to forward directly to the independent directors or the individual director all such communications, except for communications unrelated to the function of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any communications not forwarded will be retained for one year, and any independent director may request the corporate secretary to forward to the independent director any such communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corporate secretary will not share direct communications to the independent directors or an individual director with any other member of management unless instructed to do so by the lead director or the independent director to whom the communication was addressed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Annual Meetings of Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have a policy with regard to attendance by the directors at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At last years Annual Meeting of Shareholders, two directors were present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New directors attend one or more orientation sessions that introduce them to the Companys operations and to the members of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New directors also attend a formal director training program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thereafter, directors are informed on a regular basis of various director educational programs offered by governance and director organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company pays for the continuing education of its directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director orientation policy is reviewed by the Nominating and Governance Committee annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence  Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of the Company has determined that none of the current members of the Audit Committee has any relationship with the Company that could interfere with his or her exercise of independence from management and the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the members satisfies the definitions of independence set forth in the rules promulgated under the applicable rules of the SEC, the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and in the listing standards of NASDAQ.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence  Controlled Company Status
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NASDAQ requires listed companies to have a majority of independent directors on their board of directors and to ensure that their audit committee and compensation committee are composed solely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director nominees must either be selected or recommended for the board of directors selection by a nominating committee composed solely of independent directors or, if no such committee exists, a majority of the independent directors in a vote in which only the independent directors participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, independent directors must meet regularly in executive sessions at which only independent directors are present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A company that qualifies as a controlled company does not have to comply with these requirements, other than the audit committee independence and executive sessions requirements, so long as the company discloses to shareholders that the company qualifies as a controlled company and is relying on this exemption in not having a majority of independent directors on the Board or solely independent directors on the compensation committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A controlled company is a listed company of which more than 50 percent of the voting power for the election of directors is held by an individual, a group, or another company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signatories to the Scripps Family Agreement hold a majority of the Companys outstanding Common Voting Shares and as such the Company qualifies as a controlled company and may rely on the NASDAQ exemption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is not relying at present on that exemption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has determined that all of the directors, other than Kenneth W. Lowe, have no material relationship with the Company and are independent under the criteria set forth in applicable rules of the SEC, the listing standards of NASDAQ and the Companys Corporate Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, all of the members of the Audit Committee, Nominating and Governance Committee and the Compensation Committee are independent under such standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee will review any candidate recommended by a shareholder of the Company in light of the Nominating and Governance Committees criteria for selection of new directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder wishes to recommend a candidate, he or she should send the recommendation, with a description of the candidates qualifications, to: Chair, Nominating and Governance Committee, c/o Ms. Eleni Vatsis Stratigeas, Scripps Networks Interactive, Inc., 9721 Sherrill Blvd., Knoxville, TN 37932.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, the Nominating and Governance Committee has hired an independent consultant to assist with the identification and evaluation of director nominees and may do so in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nomination for Directors  Qualification Standards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When selecting new director nominees, the Nominating and Governance Committee considers requirements of applicable law and listing standards, as well as the director qualification standards highlighted in the Companys Corporate Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee seeks diversity on the Board in terms of skills, experience and other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee is responsible for reviewing with the Board the experience, qualifications, attributes and skills of nominees as well as the diversity and composition of the Board as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A person considered for nomination to the Board must be a person of high integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other factors considered are independence, age, skills, and experience in the context of the needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee makes recommendations to the Board regarding the selection of director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee is required to review annually the effectiveness of the Companys Corporate Governance Principles, including the provisions regarding director qualifications (including diversity) that are part of the Corporate Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this section, we describe our compensation philosophy objectives and programs for our Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and our other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion & Analysis (CD&A) provides:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of our business results and the alignment between executive pay, short-term and long-term Company performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How our Boards Compensation Committee determines compensation design and pay levels for specific 2016 decisions, including our compensation governance approach; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A detailed description of the elements of the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are designed to reward financial results and effective strategic leadership to build sustainable value for shareholders by correlating the timing and amount of actual pay with performance goals over various time horizons without excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our annual compensation governance process, we review the appropriate group of peer companies against which we benchmark all elements of compensation program design and company-wide pay levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation decisions and program designs for our NEOs, as discussed in this section, are intended to focus on both the short-term and long-term growth of the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs for Fiscal 2016 were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Current Title Kenneth W. Lowe Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer Lori A. Hickok Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer Burton F. Jablin Chief Operating Officer, Scripps Networks Interactive Cynthia L. Gibson Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer Mark S. Hale Executive Vice President, Global Operations & Chief Technology Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Business Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are a global media company with respected high-profile brands and are a leading developer of lifestyle-oriented content, providing primarily home, food, travel and other lifestyle-related programming.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our content is distributed via multiple methods, including television, the internet, digital platforms and licensing arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SNI portfolio of networks includes HGTV, Food Network, Travel Channel, DIY Network, Cooking Channel and Great American Country within and outside the United States (U.S.), with the exception of Great American Country, which is distributed in the United States, and Fine Living, Asian Food Channel (AFC) and TVN S.A.s (TVN) portfolio of networks outside the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, outside the United States, we participate in UKTV, a joint venture with BBC Worldwide Limited (the BBC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our businesses engage audiences and efficiently serve advertisers by producing and delivering entertaining and highly-useful content that focuses on specifically-defined topics of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to expand and enhance our lifestyle brands by: growing our brands through the creation of popular new programming and content; reaching additional demographics; extending distribution on various platforms, such as over-the-top and non-linear entrants providing streaming and/or on-demand services; and increasing our international footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a large library of content that we own the rights to indefinitely, enabling us to exploit original programming quickly and/or repackage content in a cost effective manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are focused on strengthening our linear networks and expanding reach, in both the digital arena and international market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our effort to expand in the digital arena, we launched Scripps Lifestyle Studios in the fourth quarter of 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The growth of our international business, through acquisition and joint ventures, as well as organically, has been, and continues to be, a strategic priority for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fourth quarter of 2016, we launched Cooking Channel in Canada, marking the first time we distributed this network outside the United States and Caribbean.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also during the fourth quarter of 2016, we launched HGTV in the Middle East and North Africa.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the second quarter of 2016, we launched HGTV as a free-to-air channel in New Zealand which is a first of its kind offering in the region.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2015, we acquired TVN, a Polish media company, which operates a portfolio of 13 free-to-air and pay-TV lifestyle and entertainment networks; launched Travel Channel as a 24/7 free-to-air channel in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the UK; expanded distribution of Food Network across Latin America and HGTV in Asia Pacific (APAC); launched Food Network in Australia as part of a commercial arrangement with Special Broadcasting Service (SBS); and secured a large volume output deal with Nine in Australia to launch Food Network and HGTV-branded programming blocks on newly-launched 9LIFE, Australias first free-to-air lifestyle network.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have two reportable segments: U.S. Networks and International Networks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Networks includes our six national television networks: HGTV, Food Network, Travel Channel, DIY Network, Cooking Channel and Great American Country.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, U.S. Networks includes websites associated with the aforementioned television brands and other internet and mobile businesses serving home, food, travel and other lifestyle-related categories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Networks also includes our digital content studio, Scripps Lifestyle Studios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We own 100.0 percent of each of our networks, with the exception of Food Network and Cooking Channel, of which we own 68.7 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our networks is distributed by cable and satellite operators, telecommunication suppliers and other distributors, including non-linear service providers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International Networks includes the TVN portfolio of networks and other lifestyle-oriented networks available in the United Kingdom (UK), other European markets, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA), APAC and Latin America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently broadcast 42 international unique feeds, reaching approximately 310 million subscribers under the HGTV, DIY, Food Network, AFC, Cooking Channel, Fine Living, Travel Channel brands and TVN network portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our businesses earn revenues from advertising sales, affiliate fees and ancillary sales, including licensing of our content to third parties and our brands for consumer products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Programming expenses, employee costs and marketing and advertising expenses are our primary operating costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated operating revenues were $3,401.4 million in 2016 compared with $3,018.3 million in 2015, an increase of $383.2 million, or 12.7%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated advertising revenues were $2,416.4 million in 2016, up 17.2% over 2015 driven by the inclusion of TVNs results for the entire twelve months in 2016 as well as strong pricing in the U.S. market, while consolidated affiliate fee revenues were $894.4 million in 2016, up 2.2% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated segment profit was $1,401.5 million in 2016 compared with $1,245.7 million in 2015, an increase of $155.8 million, or 12.5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment profit excludes interest, income taxes, depreciation and amortization, divested operating units, investment results and certain other items included in net income determined in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Chief Operating Decision Maker evaluates the operating performance of businesses and make decisions about the allocation of resources to our businesses using a non-GAAP measure we refer to as segment profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Items excluded from segment profit generally result from decisions made in prior periods or from decisions made by corporate executives rather than the managers of the business segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A reconciliation of segment profit to operating income determined in accordance with GAAP is provided for in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated net income attributable to the Company was $673.6 million, or $5.18 per diluted share, in 2016 compared with $606.8 million, or $4.66 per diluted share, in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Fiscal 2016 Executive Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important decisions and payouts related to 2016 are summarized below, and discussed in greater detail in the following pages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary Each NEO received a base salary increase effective January 1, 2016 ranging from 3.7% to 36.3% based on individual contributions to overall corporate results and salary level relative to market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentives Our financial goals, segment profit (65% weight) and revenue (35% weight), were achieved at 104.13% and 100.87% of target respectively, resulting in a weighted average payout of 114.78% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These achievements represent 12.5% growth in segment profit over 2015 and 12.7% growth in revenues over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term Incentives For the 2015 PBRSU grants the metric was adjusted cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company achieved 106.82%, which resulted in a payout of 134.10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs received a payout under the 2015 PBRSU grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Arrangements We entered into new or amended employment contracts with certain NEOs, including our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the need to maintain stable leadership in a time of significant change in the media industry, the Board recognized the importance of Mr. Lowes continued leadership as CEO of the company and as such entered into a new employment contract with him in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As determined by the Board, the compensation package provided to Mr. Lowe better aligns his total compensation opportunity to competitive market levels within the media industry and recognizes his outstanding performance in shareholder value creation during his time in the CEO position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the term, Mr. Lowe is entitled to a base salary of not less than $2,000,000, an annual incentive target bonus opportunity of not less than 200 percent of his salary and participation in all equity incentive, employee pension, and welfare benefit plans provided to other senior executives of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional details regarding Mr. Lowes employment agreement, please see the employment agreement section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Results Impact on Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We establish target compensation at the beginning of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executives actual pay will be above or below the target level based on individual, organizational and stock performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial portion of each NEOs compensation is in the form of equity and correlated with stock price performance so as the stock price rises or falls, so does the NEOs actual compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We employ a variety of quantitative criteria to assess the performance of our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our objectives include achieving segment profit and revenue targets in order to align executive pay with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates the relationship between performance and our CEOs compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target value represents stock options, time-based RSUs and PBRSUs at grant date value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earned/vested value represents stock options, time-based RSUs and PBRSUs granted in 2013, 2014 and 2015 that vested in 2016 and PBRSU awards granted in 2015 and earned in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All earned/vested equity awards are valued based on the Companys share price on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO compensation earned was below target total compensation, primarily driven by achievement results associated with PBRUSs and vested stock options currently below grant value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Process Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below we highlight certain executive compensation practices that we consider instrumental in driving Company performance while mitigating risk, as well as practices that we avoid because we do not believe they would serve the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Core Values
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Competitive Benchmark pay based on data from CTHRAs Cable Programmers and Broadcast Networks Compensation Survey and based on size- adjusted median of companies within our Proxy Peer Group with which we compete with in business and for talent Review Peer Group Annually review peer group for appropriateness and adjust when necessary to ensure a relevant comparison for executive compensation decisions Focus on Performance Maintain a pay mix that is heavily performance-based Balanced Performance Metrics Use performance metrics in annual incentive plan and long-term incentive plan that balance growing the Company, managing expense and generating cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Transparency Fully disclose the financial performance drivers in numeric terms used in our incentive programs Performance Reviews & Risk Consideration Reviews performance goals for annual and long-term incentive awards to confirm the use of diversified and rigorous, yet attainable targets, while avoiding excessive risk taking Restrictive Covenants NEOs are subject to restrictive covenants upon separation, including non-compete, non- solicitation and non-disclosure obligations Independent Committee Consultant Retain an independent compensation consultant engaged by, and reporting directly to, the Compensation Committee Review Committee Charter Review charter annually to maintain strong oversight and governance protocols Clawback Policy Maintain a clawback policy to permit repayment or forfeitures of cash and equity  based compensation based on restated financial results No Hedging Do not permit hedging transactions or short sales by executives or directors No Excise Tax Gross-Ups for New Employees Eliminated excise tax gross-up provisions to new executives Substantial Stock Ownership Guidelines Maintain stock ownership guidelines for executives Double Trigger Vesting Require double trigger vesting for cash severance payments for termination following a change in control Say-on-Pay Consider the views of holders of Common Voting Shares on NEO compensation of every 3 years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving the Companys executive compensation policies, plan designs and the compensation of our senior officers, including our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers various factors in determining compensation levels for NEOs, including the officers responsibilities and performance, the effectiveness of our programs in supporting the Companys short and long-term strategic objectives, and overall financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Compensation Committee coordinates the full Boards annual review of the CEOs performance and considers the Boards assessment in its compensation decisions related to the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, the Compensation Committee conducts an annual review of executive officer pay levels, reviews market data provided by the independent consultant, and approves changes to program designs, including post-termination arrangements, based on an assessment of competitive market practice and emerging trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Compensation Committee recommends succession plans to the Board and evaluates the risks associated with the Companys executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 the Compensation Committee engaged Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC (Meridian) to provide executive compensation consulting services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridians services to the Compensation Committee and the Nominating and Governance Committee have included updates on best practices and market trends in executive and director compensation, recommendations regarding executive and director compensation, and an independent review of compensation proposals by the Companys senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian attended meetings at the Compensation Committees request and was available to provide guidance as questions and issues arose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian provides no other services to the Company other than independent compensation advisory services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that Meridian is independent after consideration of the SEC independence factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Executive Officers in Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the request of the Compensation Committee, the CEO presents individual pay recommendations for each of the NEOs, other than himself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In forming his recommendations, he is advised by information provided by human resource management (i.e., Executive Vice President, Chief Human Resource Officer and Senior Vice President, Compensation and Benefits) and the independent compensation consultant with regards to assessments of individual contributions, achievement of performance objectives and other qualitative factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers these recommendations in approving the pay levels of each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO does not make recommendations concerning his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO and members of human resource management regularly attend Compensation Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Human resource management typically presents recommendations for changes to program designs and individual pay levels for executive officers, taking into consideration individual performance of each incumbent, appropriate benchmarking information and issues that may arise from an accounting, legal or tax perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive compensation program is designed to meet the following three objectives that align with and support the Companys strategic business goals:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain executives who lead the Companys efforts to build short-term and long-term value for shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward achievement of annual operating performance goals and sustained increases in shareholder value
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasize variable performance-based components of the compensation program more heavily than fixed component
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key elements of the Companys executive compensation program are base salary, annual incentives, long-term incentives consisting of stock options, time-based RSUs and PBRSUs, and retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program also includes certain perquisites, but these perquisites are not a significant element of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element of compensation is designed to fulfill the objectives discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Form Fixed or Variable Objectives Base Salary Cash Fixed     Serves as attraction and retention incentive     Rewards individual performance Annual Incentive Cash Variable     Rewards annual operating results     Emphasizes variable performance-based compensation Long-term Incentive, which includes:         Serves as attraction and retention incentive Emphasizes variable performance-based compensation     Aligns interests with shareholders Stock Options Equity Variable     Rewards for maintaining and increasing stock price and enhancing long-term value RSUs Equity Fixed     Rewards for maintaining and increasing stock price and enhancing long-term value PBRSUs Equity Variable     Rewards based on Company performance     Rewards for maintaining and increasing stock price and enhancing long-term value Retirement Benefits Cash Fixed     Serves as attraction and retention incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Mix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of the compensation program for the NEOs is variable or at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that it is contingent upon achieving specific results that are essential to the Companys long-term success and growth in shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above, the variable components of the 2016 compensation program include annual incentives and long-term incentives which are comprised of stock options and PBRSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has not established a specific formula for the allocation of fixed and variable compensation components and instead retains the discretion to modify the allocation from year to year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of Mr. Lowes total direct compensation is variable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compared to his total direct compensation in 2015, a larger percentage of Mr. Lowes total direct compensation is variable in 2016 due to the equity grants associated with his employment contract renewal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes this approach directly aligns the CEO with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As illustrated for the 2016 annual program elements, approximately 68% of the total direct compensation opportunity (i.e., TDC, or the sum of base salary, annual incentives, fixed equity, and variable equity at target) for the Companys NEOs (other than the CEO) was weighted  assuming payout at target levels  toward variable and equity components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TDC opportunity for the CEO was weighted towards variable and equity components at approximately 84%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist in reviewing the levels of compensation in 2016 Meridian collected and analyzed market data, including base salary, target short- and long-term incentive opportunities for each of the NEOs from the following published and proprietary sources:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primary Data Sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee relies on data sources from a third-party administered survey sponsored by Cable and Telecommunications Human Resources Association (CTHRA) and from publicly available proxy data from a peer group of 10 publicly-traded companies in the media industry, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AMC Networks Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lions Gate Entertainment Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CBS Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sirius XM Holdings Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discovery Communications, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starz Viacom, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Liberty Global, PLC
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies in this peer group represent some of the many companies in the media industry with which we compete in busines and for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All pay opportunities were compared with the size-adjusted median of this proxy peer group using regression analysi
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: based on revenue to reflect pay of similarly-situated executives in comparable positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Data from the CTHRA Cable Programmers, Broadcast Networks Compensation Survey:  Includes data from over 40 national cable and broadcast networks that participate in the survey each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secondary Data Sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To obtain a broader understanding of market pay levels and compensation and benefit practices, the Compensation Committee also reviews survey data from the Towers Watson Executive Compensation Database, for both general industry and media cuts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market data provides an important reference point by indicating what an executive could expect to earn at a similar peer company and what the Company might expect to pay if it should have to recruit from the outside.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, market data is only one of the many factors that the Compensation Committee considers to assess the reasonableness of pay opportunities provided to the Companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers other relevant factors such as the incumbents experience, tenure in position, talent supply and demand, cost constraints of the Company and internal equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining executive compensation for each NEO, the Compensation Committee also reviews tally sheets which provide:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: History of targeted pay for the last five years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Value of outstanding equity awards at various stock price levels;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Present value of accrued benefits under each retirement plan and current level of perquisites provided;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cumulative stock exercises and stock vesting over time; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Update on stock ownership levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Analysis of Each Compensation Element
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following is a brief summary of each element of the 2016 compensation program for the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After discussing the individual performance, experience, scope of responsibilities, and Mr. Lowes recommendations for the other NEOs, the Compensation Committee established the base salaries for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the increases are intended to align base salary levels with the market and to reflect the individual performance and scope of responsibilities of each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lowes salary increase in 2016 was an outcome of him entering a new employment contract with the Company in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hickoks salary increase in 2016 wan an outcome due to observations in market changes for Chief Financial Officer positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO   2016 Base Salary Percentage Increase  Mr. Lowe     36.3% Ms. Hickok     14.8% Mr. Jablin     5.7% Ms. Gibson     7.9% Mr. Hale     3.7%
