sentences.text: Please refer to the Salary column of the Summary Compensation Table for the 2016 base salaries of the NEOs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual incentive payout for the NEOs is based on the extent to which certain pre-established performance goals are achieved during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual incentive program is consistent with the Companys pay for performance philosophy and is also at risk because the Company must achieve certain performance goals established by the Compensation Committee for the NEOs to receive an annual incentive payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Incentive Opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs had the opportunity to earn targeted incentive cash payments that were expressed as a percentage of each executives annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target annual incentive opportunities were established by the Compensation Committee, according to each executives position and level of responsibility and positioning versus market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows the target annual incentive opportunity as of December 31, 2016 (expressed as a percentage of base salary) for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There was no change in the target annual incentive opportunity for the NEOs from 2015 with the exception of Mr. Lowe, whose target annual incentive opportunity increase in 2016 was an outcome of him entering into a new employment contract with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO   2016 Target Incentive  as a Percent of Base Salary  Mr. Lowe     200% Ms. Hickok     65% Mr. Jablin     100% Ms. Gibson     65% Mr. Hale     65%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Goals and Actual Results for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target annual incentives are earned based on the extent to which certain performance goals are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee established two performance goals for the 2016 annual performance period: segment profit and revenue, which are described in more detail below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment profit is the measure by which the Company evaluates the operating performance of each business segment and the measure of performance most frequently used by investors to determine the value of the enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The segment profit goal was based on the consolidated performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment profit is a supplemental non-GAAP financial measure that is defined in our notes to the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment profit for 2016 was adjusted to exclude
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the effects of currency fluctuations above or below budgeted levels,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) programming amortization as a result of purchase accounting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii), transaction and integration costs related to TVN above or below budgeted levels,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) expenses related to the reorganization of Travel Channel and our national television networks above or below budgeted levels and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) unbudgeted severance costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue growth is primarily achieved through growth in advertising sales and distribution fee revenues from our television networks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued growth in revenues allows us to invest and grow our existing brands and allows us the flexibility to take advantage of promising opportunities in the global media marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revenue goal was based on the Companys operating revenue as set forth in our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The above combination of a growth measure (revenue) and a profitability measure (segment profit) creates a balance between growing the Company and managing expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table provides the weights of each metric, the range of performance and payout, and the actual achievement level for each performance goal along with the payout percentage for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All amounts are shown in millions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys long-term incentive awards are consistent with the Companys pay for performance philosophy and are intended to create a direct correlation between the level of compensation paid to the NEOs and the Companys financial performance and stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rewards performance that delivers creation of sustainable shareholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides a long-term retention incentive for key employees based on the vesting period; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increases stock ownership of the NEOs so that their interests are more closely aligned with the long-term interest of the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys Long-Term Incentive Plan, the NEOs were granted equity awards as recommended by the CEO and approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved the 2016 target value of the equity awards as a percent of base salary for each NEO based on each NEOs position and level of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decisions regarding long-term incentive grants were made based on role and competitive market data to reward value creation and meet retention objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also determined that it was important to maintain internal equity among the NEOs, especially for positions of similar scope and authority in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, in addition to the other factors cited, the targets reflect the Compensation Committees strategy to ensure proper internal alignment among the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There was no change to the target value of equity awards for the NEOs from 2015 with the exception of Mr. Lowe whose target value of equity awards increase in 2016 was an outcome of him entering into a new employment contract with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This table shows the 2016 long-term incentive opportunities (expressed as a percentage of base salary) for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO   2016 Long-Term Incentive as a Percent of Base Salary  Mr. Lowe     275% Ms. Hickok     125% Mr. Jablin     225% Ms. Gibson     125% Mr. Hale     125%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016 we used three long-term incentive vehicles targeting the mix in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Form of Equity   Percent of Target Long-Term Incentive Award  Stock Options    40% Restricted Share Units (RSUs)    30% Performance-Based Restricted Share Units (PBRSUs)    30%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This combination of these forms of equity balances the need for retention with the focus on share price appreciation, both on an absolute and a relative basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Off-Cycle Grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, in response to promotional opportunities, retention concerns, or renewal of employment agreements, the Company may provide select key executives with an off-cycle grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards typically vest over multiple years either through passage of time or the requirement of various levels of performance achievement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lowe received a PBRSU grant of $4,000,000 on January 1, 2016 with performance goals tied to earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) for both 2017 and 2018, with the portion that will be earned vesting 50% on December 31, 2017 and 50% on December 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with his new employment contract, Mr. Lowe received a PBRSU grant of $10,000,000 on August 30, 2016 with adjusted net income performance goals, with the portion that will be earned vesting 30% on December 31, 2017, 30% on December 31, 2018 and 40% on December 31, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lowe received a PBRSU grant of $2,500,000 on August 30, 2016 with performance goals related to succession planning activities, with the portion that will be earned vesting on January 1, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This equity structure was put in place as a retention vehicle in order to provide for Mr. Lowes continued leadership at the Company and in order to allow sufficient opportunity for succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options only have a value when the Companys stock price is greater than the options exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This incentivizes NEOs to increase share price which benefits our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, stock options help to align the interests of NEOs with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stock options serve as an important retention device as they vest over three years and, if not vested, are forfeited if the employee voluntarily terminates before retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock option grants have an exercise price equal to the fair market value of the underlying shares on the date of grant and have an eight-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These grants provide for accelerated vesting on a pro-rata basis for termination without cause or for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-Based Restricted Share Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each RSU corresponds in value to a single share of Company Class A Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, as share price increases, RSUs become more valuable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This creates an incentive for our NEOs to increase share price which benefits our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-based RSUs also provide NEOs the opportunity to increase their stock ownership levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, RSUs serve as an effective retention incentive as they vest over three years and unvested RSUs are forfeited if the employee voluntarily terminates before retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This serves to align the interests of the NEOs with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These grants provide for accelerated vesting on pro-rata basis for termination without cause or for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Restricted Share Units (2016 Grants).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PBRSU awards provide NEOs with an opportunity to increase their stock ownership levels and at the same time serve as retention incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares ultimately earned is dependent upon the level of the Companys achievement of performance targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 PBRSU grant, the two-year performance period began on January 1, 2016 and ends on December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares are earned if the targeted adjusted cash flow is achieved by more than the threshold as illustrated in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The earned units, if any, vest 50% on each of February 28, 2018 and February 28, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These grants provide for accelerated vesting in full for termination without cause or for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Restricted Share Units (2015 Grants).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015 PBRSU grant, the two-year performance period began on January 1, 2015 and ended on December, 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys adjusted cash flow was 106.82% of the target for the performance period, resulting in performance payout of 134.10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the equity awards granted to NEOs in 2016, please refer to the Grants of Plan- Based Awards table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For information about the total number of stock options, RSUs and PBRSUs outstanding as of the end of 2016 with respect to each NEO, please refer to the Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year-End table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides savings and retirement benefits through the Scripps Networks Interactive Pension Plan and the Scripps Networks Interactive 401K Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension plan is closed to new participants and the credited service levels used for benefit calculation purposes are frozen; however, consideration of salary growth to calculate benefit levels continues for a ten-year transition period that ends December 31, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan participants will continue to accrue service for vesting and early retirement eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401K Savings Plan includes a Company match of 50% of the employees contribution up to 6% of eligible compensation, and a Company contribution of up to 8% based on a combination of age and service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Company contribution, which went into effect on January 1, 2010, was intended to mirror some of the financial benefits available under the defined benefit plan that was frozen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To attract and retain key executive talent, the Company has determined that it is important to provide the management team, including the NEOs, with retirement benefits that are in addition to those generally provided to its employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These restorative plans listed below allow the NEOs to receive the same benefit as other plan participants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company supplements the pension plan for pension-eligible executives whose salary and contributions exceed the IRS limitations through the Companys Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (SERP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the transitional freeze of the defined benefit plan, the SERP was also transitionally frozen, effective January 1, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs may also defer specified portions of their compensation under the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, and receive matching contributions, in each case in excess of what they are able to defer under the 401K Savings Plan due to IRS limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to legal restrictions for plan design, the transitional freeze of the defined benefit pension plan and accompanying transitional freeze of the Companys SERP had a disproportionately negative impact on some employees of the Company, including some of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to address this disproportionately negative impact, the Company added a Supplemental Contribution Plan (SCP), effective January 1, 2010 to allow for Company contributions based on a combination of age and service above the IRS contribution limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The changes to the Companys plans also had a disproportionately negative impact on employees as their relative ages and length of service increased.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To address this negative impact, the Company contribution to the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan was increased for a group of employees based on age and length of service, including the four NEOs who participate in the pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2011, the SCP was merged into the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan for ease of administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the SERP and the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan are important retention tools, as many of the companies with which the Company competes for executive talent provide similar benefits to their senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides executives with benefits comparable to those they would receive at other companies within our industry and are necessary for us to remain competitive in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee considers these arrangements to be fair and reasonable in light of the relatively low cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the NEOs received a financial planning benefit pursuant to the terms of their employment agreements, plus an additional payment to cover the taxes associated with the compensation value of this benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also received membership in dining and business clubs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Lowe receives a monthly travel stipend for his trips to New York.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are also eligible for an executive physical.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, the majority of the cost associated with this benefit is covered under the healthcare plans offered to the Companys employees; however, if certain tests or procedures are not covered, the Company will pay for the difference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about the perquisites provided in 2016 to each NEO, please refer to the All Other Compensation column of the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Plans and Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains employment agreements with each of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These employment agreements enhance retention incentives for the NEOs and also protect the Companys interests by imposing confidentiality, non-competition, non- solicitation and other restrictive covenants on the executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company entered into new employment agreements with two NEOs in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company entered into a new employment agreement with Mr. Lowe effective August 30, 2016 and the Company exercised the option to extend Mr. Hales employment agreement through December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional details on the employment agreements for our NEOs, please refer to the Employment Agreements section contained within this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO would be entitled to severance benefits under his/her employment agreement in the event of an involuntary termination of employment without cause or a termination by the executive for good reason, death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO, other than Jablin would also be entitled to certain severance benefits upon a termination of employment following the expiration of the term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance benefits for each of the NEOs are determined based upon a multiple of base pay and annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exchange for the severance benefits, the NEOs agree not to disclose Company confidential information and agree not to compete against the Company or solicit its employees or customers for a period of time after termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These provisions protect the Companys interests and help to ensure its long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2011, the Company adopted the Executive Severance Plan, which was most recently amended and restated in 2014 (ESP), that provides severance benefits to certain executives upon involuntary termination, death and disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESP also provides benefits for termination for good reason for executives with employment agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance benefits are generally based upon a multiple of base salary and annual incentive, depending upon the level of responsibility of the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESP was adopted to codify existing practices, to ensure consistency in benefits payable upon termination and to provide for protection of the Company through the inclusion of confidentiality, non-compete and non-interference obligations in exchange for the receipt of benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs are covered under the ESP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs are provided change in control protection under the Companys Executive Change in Control Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this plan, a NEO would be entitled to certain severance benefits if a change in control were to occur and the Company terminated the executives employment without cause or the executive terminated his/her employment with the Company for good reason within a two-year period following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the benefits available under the Executive Change in Control Plan under these circumstances, Mr. Lowe is entitled to certain additional benefits under his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance levels in the Change in Control Plan were adopted by the Compensation Committee in 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan was frozen to new participants beginning in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A new plan, 2012 Executive Change in Control Plan, was added for new hires beginning in 2012 that is the same as the 2008 plan with the exception that it does not include a gross-up provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the occurrence, or potential occurrence, of a change in control transaction will create uncertainty regarding the continued employment of NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change in control protections allow NEOs to focus on the Companys business and objectively evaluate the benefits to shareholders of proposed transactions without being distracted by potential job loss.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also enhances retention following a change in control, as the severance benefits are payable only if the executive incurs a qualifying termination within a certain period following a change in control, rather than merely as a result of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Change in Control Plan conditions the severance benefits upon certain confidentiality, non-compete and non-solicitation obligations which further protect the continuity of the Companys business following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All equity awards held by employees would immediately vest upon a change in control, under the Long-Term Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike the cash severance described above, the vesting is not contingent upon a qualifying termination within a certain period following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This single trigger is appropriate because the equity of the Company will change and the Company believes NEOs, along with all participants, should have the same opportunity to realize value as common shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to the Description of Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control section of this proxy statement for information regarding potential payments and benefits, if any, that each NEO is entitled to receive under his/her employment agreement and applicable plans in connection with his/her termination of employment as well as in connection with a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Governance Items
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Grant Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves annual equity awards at its February meeting, which are subsequently issued on March 1st based on the closing price of the Companys Class A Common Shares on such date (or the last trading day prior to such date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This meeting date is set typically two years in advance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not grant equity compensation awards in anticipation of the release of material nonpublic information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, the Company does not time the release of material nonpublic information based on equity award grant dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective November 2011, the Company adopted stock ownership guidelines for all NEOs in addition to executive officers to encourage ownership in the Company for the executives who have a direct impact on the decisions that contribute to the long-term success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines give the executive five years to attain the prescribed ownership levels which are established as a target multiple of base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target multiples for the NEOs are on the table to the right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mandatory Retirement Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2011, the Company adopted a mandatory retirement policy pursuant to which all bona fide executives as defined under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act, will be required to retire at the age of 65, unless otherwise determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the NEOs qualifies as a bona fide executive and will be subject to the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lowes employment agreement, which was approved by the Board, extended his employment until December 31, 2019, which is approximately three years after he turns 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-hedging and Prohibition on Pledging Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy on insider trading prohibits directors, officers and certain key employees from engaging in short sales, purchases of puts and calls and other speculative or hedging transactions with respect to Company stock, regardless of whether they do or do not hold material, non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, directors, officers and certain key employees are prohibited from holding Company stock in a margin account or pledging Company stock to secure a loan unless a prior approval is obtained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Income Deduction Limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally sets a limit of $1 million on the amount of non-performance-based compensation that the Company may deduct for federal income tax purposes in any given year with respect to the compensation of each of the NEOs other than the Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifying performance-based compensation will not be subject to the deduction limit if certain requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee intends to preserve the tax deductibility of compensation paid to our executive officers to the extent consistent with our overall program objectives and philosophy, but recognizes that doing so may not always be feasible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the need to maintain flexibility in administering our executive compensation program, the Compensation Committee retains discretion to recommend to the Board executive compensation that may not be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of management from the Companys human resources, finance and legal groups assessed whether the Companys compensation policies and practices encourage excessive or inappropriate risk taking by our employees, including employees other than our NEOs and reported the results to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the review included a detailed analysis of the following risk factors related to compensation: pay mix, performance goals, performance metrics/target, market comparisons and checks and balances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The review also analyzed whether there was any link between the Companys key business risks and its compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the review, and in consultation with Meridian, the Compensation Committee determined that its compensation policies and practices did not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreement for Mr. Lowe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lowe serves as Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer pursuant to an employment agreement that was most recently amended in 2016 and extends the term through December 31, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the term, Mr. Lowe is entitled to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a base salary of not less than $2,000,000 and an annual incentive target bonus opportunity of not less than 200 percent of his salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) participate in all equity incentive, employee pension, and welfare benefit plans on a basis no less favorable than the most favorable basis provided other senior executives of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) payment of a lump sum equal to 3.0 times his base salary and 2.0 times his target annual incentive upon termination without cause or for good reason; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) reimbursement for tax and financial planning up to maximum of $15,000 per year, the annual membership fees and other dues associated with one country club and one luncheon club, and the costs of an annual physical examination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Agreement, Mr. Lowe will serve in his current roles until the later of January 1, 2019 or the date that the Board appoints a new Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan as described below was in effect through December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan is a tax-qualified pension plan covering substantially all eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan was transitionally frozen effective December 31, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms and conditions of the Pension Plan as they pertained to the NEOs in 2016 included the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to applicable Internal Revenue Code limits on benefits, the monthly normal retirement benefit is equal to 1 percent of the participants average monthly compensation up to an integration level plus 1.25 percent of the participants average monthly compensation in excess of the integration level, multiplied by the participants years of service as of December 31, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The integration level is the average of the Social Security taxable wage bases for the thirty-five years prior to the participants termination (or disability, if applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average monthly compensation is the monthly average of the compensation earned during the five consecutive years in the eleven years before termination for which the participants compensation was the highest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the applicable Internal Revenue Code limit ($265,000 for 2016), compensation includes salary, annual incentives, and amounts deferred pursuant to the SNI 401K Savings Plan and the Company Flex Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normal Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant is eligible for a normal retirement benefit based on the benefit formula described above if his employment terminates on or after age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant is eligible for an early retirement benefit if his/her employment terminates on or after age 55 and he/she has completed 10 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The early retirement benefit is equal to the normal retirement benefit described above, reduced by 0.4167 percent for each month the benefit commences before age 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Lowe, Jablin, and Hale are the only NEOs currently eligible for an early retirement benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not grant extra years of service to any NEO under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Vested Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each participant who ceases to be employed by the Company for any reason other than death, after his completion of at least five years of credited service, and who does not qualify to receive any other benefit under the plan, shall be eligible to receive a deferred vested benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Form of Benefit Payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit formula calculates the amount of benefit payable in the form of a monthly life annuity (which is the normal form of benefit for an unmarried participant).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The normal form of payment for a married participant is a joint and 100 percent survivor annuity, which provides a reduced monthly amount for the participants life with the surviving spouse receiving the same monthly amount for life.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other optional forms of payment include a lump sum, joint and 50 percent or 100 percent survivor annuity (which provides a reduced monthly amount for the participants life with the survivor receiving 50 percent or 100 percent of the monthly amount for life), or a monthly life annuity with a 10-year certain or 5-year certain guarantee (which provides a reduced monthly amount for the participants life and, if the participant dies within 10 or 5 years of benefit commencement, equal payments to a designated beneficiary for the remainder of the 10-year or 5-year certain period, as applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All forms of benefit payment are the actuarially equivalent of the monthly life annuity form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SERP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP was intended to attract and retain executive talent by supplementing benefits payable under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP was amended effective January 1, 2010 in connection with the transitional freeze of the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms and conditions of the SERP as they pertained to the NEOs in 2016 included the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive generally is eligible to participate in the SERP if he/she qualifies for a Pension Plan benefit that was limited by application of the Internal Revenue Code limits on compensation and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP benefit is equal to the difference between the Pension Plan benefit calculated using the SERP definition of compensation and the actual Pension Plan benefit plus a 1.45 percent gross up for the employee Medicare tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It may also include a 0.9 percent gross up for the additional Medicare Tax for High-Income Taxpayers if applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation includes all compensation included under the Pension Plan (without application of the IRS limit described under the Pension Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Entitlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant becomes entitled to a SERP benefit upon termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit is paid in a single lump sum in the 7th month following termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Executive Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO is eligible to defer up to 50 percent of his/her pre-tax base salary and up to 100 percent of his/her pre-tax annual incentive compensation under the terms of the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan is available to a select group of highly compensated employees and is informally funded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each participant is also entitled to a 50 percent matching credit on base salary deferrals, up to 3 percent of base salary over the applicable Internal Revenue Code limit ($265,000 for 2016), and any annual incentive deferrals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Deferred Compensation Plan, excess age and service credits are made on behalf of participants whose age and service contributions under the 401K Savings Plan are subject to limits imposed by the IRS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments from the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan are made in cash at certain future dates specified by participants or upon earlier termination of employment or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, payments are made in the form of a lump sum or in monthly installments of 5, 10 or 15 years, as elected by the participants, and are automatically accelerated and paid in a lump sum in the event of a termination of employment within two years following a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The excess age and service credits are paid in cash in a single lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred compensation is credited with earnings, gains and losses in accordance with deemed investment elections made by participants from among various crediting options established by the Company from time-to-time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are permitted to change their deemed investment elections daily.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the investment options tracked returns under publicly available and externally managed investment funds such as mutual funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The estimated amount of compensation and benefits described below does not take into account compensation and benefits that a NEO has earned prior to the applicable triggering event, such as equity awards that had previously vested in accordance with their terms, or vested benefits otherwise payable under the retirement plans and programs (unless those benefits are enhanced or accelerated).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreement for Mr. Lowe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Mr. Lowes employment agreement, if the Company terminates the agreement without cause or the executive terminates it for good reason (other than within two years following a change in control), he is entitled to a lump sum payment equal to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 3.0 times his annual salary and 2.0 times his target annual incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the pro-rated annual incentive opportunity for the year based on actual performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 24 months of the COBRA premium in effect at the time of termination for continued medical coverage;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) full vesting of all equity awards, with the options remaining exercisable for the remainder of the original term, except that any outstanding PBRSUs granted with a performance period commencing after January 1, 2014 will only become fully vested at the end of the applicable performance period, and then only to the extent that the Company achieved the applicable performance goals for that performance period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) continued life insurance coverage through the end of term; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) one year of financial planning benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the employment agreement of Mr. Jablin, if the Company terminates the agreement without cause or the executive terminates it for good reason (other than within two years following a change in control), he is entitled to a lump sum payment equal to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 2.5 times the executives annual salary and target annual incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the pro-rated annual incentive opportunity for the year based on actual performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 18 months of the COBRA premium in effect at the time of termination for continued medical coverage;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) full vesting of restricted stock awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) one year of financial planning benefits; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) life insurance for 30 months following termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the employment agreements for Ms. Hickok, Ms. Gibson and Mr. Hale, if the Company terminates the agreement without cause or the executive terminates it for good reason (other than within two years following a change in control), each of them is entitled to a lump sum payment equal to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 1.5 times the executives annual salary and target annual incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the pro-rated annual incentive opportunity for the year based on actual performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 18 months of the COBRA premium in effect at the time of termination for continued medical coverage;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) continued life insurance coverage for 1.5 years following the date of termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) one year of financial planning benefits; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) for Ms. Hickok, the value of the additional accruals under the pension plan and SERP for the period from the date of termination through the date the executive would have reached age 55 with at least 10 years of service and additional non- elective contributions to the 401K Savings Plan and Deferred Compensation Plan for the same period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of each of these employment agreements, the term cause generally includes embezzlement, fraud or a felony; unauthorized disclosure of confidential information; a material breach of the agreement; gross misconduct or gross neglect of duties; failure to cooperate with an internal or regulatory investigation; or a violation of the Companys written conduct policies or ethics code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term good reason generally includes a material reduction in duties or compensation; relocation outside principal place of employment; or a material breach of the employment agreement by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exchange for the benefits described above, Mr. Lowe agreed not to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) disclose the Companys confidential information;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) compete against the Company for 6 months after termination (12 months if terminated for cause);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) solicit the Companys employees or customers for 12 months after termination; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) disparage the Company for 12 months after termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) disclose the Companys confidential information;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) compete against the Company for 12 months after termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) solicit the Companys employees or customers for 12 months after termination; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) disparage the Company for 12 months after termination.

sentences.text: Death or Disability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreement for Mr. Lowe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Mr. Lowes employment agreement, if he dies or suffers a permanent disability, the executive, his estate and/or his family become entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to 2.0 times annual salary (subject to reduction for any proceeds received under any life insurance policy or the Companys disability plans).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual payments equal to 60 percent of his base salary, commencing within 30 days after the date of his permanent disability and ending at age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued medical and dental benefits for two years (29 months in the case of permanent disability).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to a pro-rated target annual incentive from January 1 of the year of death or permanent disability through the first anniversary of that event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term permanent disability has the meaning as defined under the Companys disability plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Employment Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the employment agreements for each of Ms. Hickok, Mr. Jablin, Ms. Gibson and Mr. Hale, if the executive dies or becomes disabled (as defined under and covered by the Company disability plan), the executive (or their estate) would receive the same benefits as if the Company had terminated the agreement without cause or if executive terminated for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a NEO dies or becomes disabled, any equity awards issued under the Companys 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan and 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan will become fully vested, and in the case of stock options, be exercisable until their expiration date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control, all outstanding equity awards held by the NEOs will vest, with the options remaining exercisable for the remainder of the original terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A change in control generally means
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the acquisition of a majority of the Companys common voting shares by someone other than a party to the Scripps Family Agreement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the disposition of assets accounting for 90 percent or more of the Companys revenues, unless the parties to the Scripps Family Agreement have a direct or indirect controlling interest in the acquiring entity, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a change in the membership of the Companys Board, such that the current incumbents and their approved successors no longer constitute a majority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifying Termination Following a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Executive Change in Control Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO participates in the Senior Executive Change in Control Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this plan, if the executives employment is terminated by the Company without cause, or if the executive resigns for good reason, within two years after a change in control, then the Company or its successor will be obligated to pay or provide the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to 3.0 times for Mr. Lowe, 2.5 times for Mr. Jablin, 2.0 times for Ms. Hickok, Ms. Gibson and Mr. Hale of the executives annual base salary and annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this purpose, annual incentive generally means the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) target in the year of termination or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the highest annual incentive earned in the prior three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued medical, dental, disability, life and accidental death insurance coverage for 36 months for Mr. Lowe, 30 months for Mr. Jablin, and 24 months for Ms. Hickok, Ms. Gibson and Mr. Hale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to the actuarial value of the additional benefits under the Companys qualified and supplemental defined benefit plans and defined contribution plans the executive would have received if his/her age and years of service at the time of termination were increased by 3.0 years for Mr. Lowe, 2.5 years for Mr. Jablin, and 2.0 years for Ms. Hickok, Ms. Gibson and Mr. Hale (supplemental defined contribution plan only).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A tax gross-up for any excise taxes imposed on excess parachute payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the change in control plan, the term cause generally includes a commission of a felony or an act that impairs the Companys reputation; willful failure to perform duties; or breach of any material term, provision or condition of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term good reason generally includes a reduction in compensation or duties; relocation outside of principal place of employment; or a material breach of the employment terms by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the benefits under the Executive Change in Control Plan, Mr. Lowes employment agreement provides that he is entitled to receive reasonable outplacement services for a period of 18 months as well as reimbursement for reasonable legal expenses (up to $75,000) if he is required to enforce the agreement in the event of a qualifying termination following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exchange for these benefits, the executives agree not to compete against the Company or its successors, or solicit their employees, customers, vendors or advertisers for a period of one year after termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Annual Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Executive Annual Incentive Plan, in the event that a participants employment terminates within one year of a change in control, the Company or its successor would be required to pay a lump sum amount to the participant equal to the target annual incentive opportunity for the performance period in which the termination occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) Matching charitable contributions through Companys matching gift program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Director Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys director compensation program is designed to enhance its ability to attract and retain highly qualified directors and to align their interests with the long-term interests of its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program includes a cash component, which is designed to compensate non-employee directors for their service on the Board and an equity component, which is designed to align the interests of non-employee directors and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides certain other benefits to non-employee directors, which are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees of the Company receive no additional compensation for their service on the Boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is entitled to receive an annual cash retainer of $70,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee chairs also receive an annual retainer as described in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retainers are paid in equal quarterly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is also entitled to receive a fee for each committee meeting attended, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting Fees   Executive Committee per meeting fee  $ 2,000  Audit Committee per meeting fee  $ 2,500  Compensation Committee per meeting fee  $ 2,500  Nominating and Governance Committee per meeting fee  $ 2,000  Pricing Committee per meeting fee  $ 2,500  Digital Advisory Committee per meeting fee  $ 2,500  Executive Committee annual chair fee  $ 3,000  Audit Committee annual chair fee  $ 20,000  Compensation Committee annual chair fee  $ 20,000  Nominating & Governance Committee annual chair fee  $ 10,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is entitled to receive annual grants of a stock option grant with a grant date value of $75,000 and a RSU with a grant value of $75,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock options are exercisable one year from the date of grant, but may be forfeited upon removal from the Board for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSU awards are payable on the first anniversary of the date of grant, but may be forfeited upon removal from the Board for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the above compensation, the Companys matching gift program, matches, on a dollar-for-dollar basis up to $5,000 annually, charitable contributions made by non-employee directors to qualifying organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional matching contributions are made for disaster relief contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program is also available to all of the Companys employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation and Stock Plan for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-employee director may elect to defer payment of a designated percentage of the cash compensation received as a director under the Companys Deferred Compensation and Stock Plan for Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director may allocate the deferrals between a phantom stock account that credits earnings including dividends, based on Class A Common Shares, or to a fixed income account that credits interest based on the twelve month average of the 10-year treasury rate (as of November of each year), plus 1 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred amounts (as adjusted for earnings, interest and losses) are paid to the director at the time he or she ceases to serve as a director or upon a date predetermined by the director, either in a lump sum or annual installments over a specified number of years (not to exceed 15) as elected by the director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments generally are made in the form of cash, except that the director may elect to receive all or a portion of the amounts credited to his or her phantom stock account in the form of Class A Common Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective August 2011, the Board adopted director stock ownership guidelines that require each non-employee director to hold a specified amount of our Class A Common Shares, based on a multiple of three times the directors then-current annual retainer for board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is expected to satisfy the stock ownership guidelines within three years from the date the director is appointed as a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined that any shares of our Class A Common Shares beneficially owned by the director, as well as awards of RSUs and deferred phantom stock, would be counted for purposes of satisfying the stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a director meets the target, the director is expected to maintain his or her stock ownership pursuant to the guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for as long as he or she remains a member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-employee directors who have served as directors of the Company for three years or more have reached and maintained the stock ownership target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed the Compensation Discussion and Analysis contained in this Proxy Statement with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Compensation Committees review of and the discussions with management with respect to the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this Proxy Statement and in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Respectfully submitted,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE INTERLOCKS AND INSIDER PARTICIPATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Compensation Committee is a current or former employee of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our executive officers served as a member of the compensation committee or a director of another company where such companys executive officers served on our Board or Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Party Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Audit Committee generally is responsible for reviewing any proposed related party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has approved a Statement of Policy with Respect to Related Party Transactions which recognizes that related party transactions can present a heightened risk of conflicts of interest and/or improper valuation (or the perception thereof).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy defines a related party, requires that executive officers and directors (or nominees for director) report any related party transactions (or potential related party transactions) to the Companys chief legal officer, who will then report each transaction that the chief legal officer determines is a related party transaction (or potential related party transaction) to the Audit Committee for its approval or ratification, and defines disclosure procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act requires that we provide the holders of Common Voting Shares with the opportunity to approve, on a non-binding, advisory basis, the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal, commonly referred to as a say-on-pay proposal, gives the holders of Common Voting Shares the opportunity to express their views on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with this proposal, the Board of Directors encourages the holders of the Common Voting Shares to review in detail the description of the compensation program for our NEOs that is set forth in the Compensation Discussion & Analysis (CD&A) section of this proxy statement, as well as the information contained in the compensation tables and narrative discussion in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in more detail in the CD&A section of this proxy statement, the Compensation Committee relied upon its independent consulting firm, Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC to assist in evaluating and determining levels of compensation in 2016 through analysis of comprehensive market data, including base salary, target short-term incentives and long-term incentive opportunities for each of the NEOs from the proxy data from a peer group of 10 media companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking the holders of Common Voting Shares to indicate their support for the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement by voting FOR the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that holders of the Common Voting Shares of the Company approve, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, the compensation of the NEOs of the Company, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and narrative discussion in the Companys 2017 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the Common Voting Shares present and entitled to vote at the annual meeting is required to approve the advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board of Directors, the Compensation Committee or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, however, will review the voting results and will take them into consideration when making future decisions regarding the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote FOR the approval of the compensation of the Companys NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Shareholder Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act also requires that we provide the holders of Common Voting Shares with the opportunity every 6 years to vote, on a nonbinding, advisory basis, for their preference as to how frequently we should seek future advisory say-on-pay votes on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, we are asking the holders of Common Voting Shares to indicate, on a nonbinding, advisory basis, whether they would prefer an advisory say-on-pay vote on the compensation of our NEOs to occur every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of Common Voting Shares also may, if they wish, abstain from casting a vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, our Board of Directors determined and continues to believe that an advisory say-on-pay vote on the compensation of our NEOs that occurs on a triennial basis is the most appropriate alternative for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that the advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs occur every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote by choosing the option of one year, two years, three years or abstain from voting in response to the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the holders of the Companys Common Voting Shares determine, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, whether the preferred frequency for holding an advisory (non-binding) vote on the compensation of the Companys NEOs, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the narrative discussion in the Companys 2017 proxy statement, should be every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of one year, two years or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast by the holders of Common Voting Shares will be considered to be their preferred frequency for the advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the vote is advisory, however, it will not be binding on the Board of Directors, the Compensation Committee or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may decide, in its sole discretion, that it is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders to hold an advisory say-on-pay vote on the compensation of our NEOs more or less frequently than the option receiving the most votes cast by the holders of Common Voting Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote FOR the option of once every three years as the preferred frequency for holding an advisory vote on the compensation of the Companys NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of Independent Registered Public Accountants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent external audit firm retained to audit the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed Deloitte & Touche LLP (Deloitte) as independent registered public accountants for the Company for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder ratification of the selection of Deloitte as our independent registered public accounting firm is not required by law or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board of Directors is submitting the selection of Deloitte to the holders of Common Voting Shares for ratification as a matter of good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the holders of Common Voting Shares do not ratify the selection of Deloitte, the Audit Committee will reconsider the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of Deloitte is expected to be present at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders, will have an opportunity to make a statement if he or she desires, and will be available to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the Common Voting Shares issued and outstanding and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders, present in person or by proxy, is necessary to ratify the appointment of Deloitte as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each proxy for Common Voting Shares executed and returned by a holder of such shares will be voted for the ratification of Deloitte as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal 2017, unless otherwise indicated on such proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will be equivalent to a vote against this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote FOR ratification of the appointment of Deloitte as our independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence of the External Auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has established a pre-approval policy and procedures for audit, audit-related and tax services that can be performed by the independent auditors without specific authorization from the Audit Committee subject to certain restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy sets out the specific services pre-approved by the Audit Committee and the applicable limitations, while ensuring the independence of the independent auditors to audit the Companys financial statements is not impaired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Service Fees Paid to the Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table sets forth fees for all professional services rendered by Deloitte to the Company for the years ended December 31, 2016 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Audit fees include the audit of the parent company and certain subsidiary companies, quarterly reviews and accounting consultations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Audit-related fees include fees for audits of employee benefit plans, due diligence assistance, audits in connection with dispositions, and other attestations by Deloitte, including those that are required by statute or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company did not retain Deloitte to audit the employee benefit plans in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed with the Companys management and Deloitte, the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, the audited financial statements of the Company for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has also discussed with Deloitte all matters required by generally accepted auditing standards to be discussed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from Deloitte required by the applicable regulations of the Public Accounting Oversight Board regarding Deloittes communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, has discussed with Deloitte the independent public accountants independence, and has concluded that Deloitte is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions noted above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board that the audited financial statements be included in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Respectfully submitted,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ronald W. Tysoe, Chair Michael R. Costa Richelle P. Parham Jeffrey Sagansky Donald E. Meihaus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 16(a) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP COMPLIANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires the Companys directors and executive officers, and beneficial owners of more than 10 percent of the Companys Class A Common Shares (10 percent shareholders), to file with the SEC initial reports of ownership and reports of changes in ownership of Class A Common Shares and other equity securities of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers, directors and 10 percent shareholders are required by SEC regulations to furnish the Company with copies of all forms they file pursuant to Section 16(a).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following individuals filed late Form 4s, in each case by one business day, during the year ended December 31, 2016: Richelle P. Parham (director) (one report relating to a sale of Class A Common Shares) and Burton F. Jablin (executive officer) (one report relating to a receipt of Class A Common Shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Form 4 filed by each non-employee director reporting the grant of options on May 11, 2016 misstated the number of securities acquired; the correct number was later reported on Form 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Companys knowledge, based solely on review of the copies of such reports furnished to the Company and written representations that no other reports were required, during the year ended December 31, 2016, other than as set forth above, all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to its executive officers, directors and 10 percent shareholders were complied with.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER PROPOSALS FOR 2018 ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder proposals intended to be presented at the Companys 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders must be received by the Company at 9721 Sherrill Blvd., Knoxville, TN 37932, on or before November 29, 2017, for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement and form of proxy relating to the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder proposals may be presented only by holders of Common Voting Shares, the only class of shares entitled to vote on such proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a holder of Common Voting Shares intends to raise a proposal at the Companys 2018 annual meeting that he or she does not seek to have included in the Companys proxy statement, the shareholder must notify the Company of the proposal on or before February 12, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shareholder fails to notify the Company, the Companys proxies will be permitted to use their discretionary voting authority with respect to such proposal when and if it is raised at such annual meeting, whether or not there is any discussion of such proposal in the 2018 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The solicitation of proxies is made by and on behalf of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cost of the solicitation will be borne by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may also reimburse banks, brokerage firms and other custodians, nominees and fiduciaries for reasonable expenses incurred by them in sending proxy materials to the beneficial owners of the Companys Class A Common Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters shall properly come before the meeting, the persons named in the proxy, or their substitutes, will vote thereon in accordance with their judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not know of any other matters which will be presented for action at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
